result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges, DNA surcharge.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.   Court does not order a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with the victim.
No illegally controlled substances.
AODA, programs or treatment as recommended.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, immigration warnings and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one and 14CF4596.

Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (67 pages) commencing JUNE 19, 2015 received and filed.
Corrected presentence investigation filed./ds

Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant filed a pro se motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict.  Court advises the defendant the appellate counsel will handle all post-conviction motions, that he is represented by counsel and Court will not address that motion today.  Sentencing proceeds.  Corrections made to the PSI report.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years - consecutive to case 14cf4596; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years - consecutive to Count 1 and case 14cf4596.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no contact with the victim; 2) pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges - Court does not order a civil judgment; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) absolute sobriety; 7) provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharges; 8) any additional counseling recommended. 

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample, immigration warnings and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.   

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence  received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
EFFECTIVE August 1, 2015, this case will be transferred to the Honorable Dennis Moroney, Branch #20, in Room 413 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Pro Se Motion for Judgment Notwithstanding the Verdict with Supporting Documents:
Hillside Police Report

Police Report on 10/10/14 by Ismar Kulenovic Pages 9-11

Court ordered presentence investigation. Order for presentence investigation filed; copy to Probation Dept.  
Case adjourned to 6-19-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 30.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury in the box at 8:58 a.m.  Court instructs the jury.  Cause argued by counsel.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror chosen by lot and discharged.   Deputy Sheriff's Vu Do and Wayne Adam sworn to take charge of the jury.  Jury retired to deliberate at the hour of 10:24 a.m.  Jury questions and answers put on the record.  Jury in the box at 2:18 p.m.  Videos and phone recordings played for the jury.  Jury out of the box at 3:00 p.m.  On the same day at the hour of 4:20 p.m.  the jury returned and by the Foreperson brought in verdicts that were then and there read by the Court.  
-We, the Jury, find the Defendant Guilty of Intimidation of a Victim, in manner and form as charged in Count #1 of the Information.  If you find the defendant guilty, you must answer the following question "yes" or "no":  Was the defendant's act in furtherance of any conspiracy? Yes
-We, the Jury, find the Defendant Guilty of Intimidation of a Witness, in manner and form as charged in Count #2 of the Information. If you find the defendant guilty, you must answer the following question "yes" or "no". Was the defendant's act in furtherance of any conspiracy? Yes.
Court polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Verdicts received and filed. Court discharged the jury.  State motion for judgment on the verdicts granted by the Court. Exhibit list, in writing, received and filed.

Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:31 a.m.  Milwaukee Police Detective Dawn Jones remains under oath.  Exhibits 52, 53, 54, 55, 56, 57, 58, 59, 60, 43, 44, 46, 64, 65, 66, 61, 62 and 63 offered and received into evidence. Jury out of the box at 10:43 a.m.  Court takes a short break.  Defendant examined as to his right to remain silent.  Court finds defendant is freely voluntarily and intelligently waives his right to remain silent.  Jury in the box at 11:15 a.m.  Exhibits 20, 21 and 22 offered and received into evidence.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for the Defendant: Montreavous Gray.  Jury out of the box at 11:51 a.m.  Court breaks for lunch.  Jury in the box at 1:47 p.m.  Montreavous Gray remains on the stand.  Defendant rests.  Jury out of the box at 3:02 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 3:29 p.m.  Sworn as rebuttal for the State: Milwaukee Police Detective Dawn Jones.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of the box at 3:37 p.m.  Court takes a short break.  Jury in the box at 3:40 p.m.  Court excuses the jury for the night.  Case adjourned to 5-1-2015 at 8:30 a.m. for jury trial in Branch 30.  Jury trial scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Sworn for the state:  Terika Dilworth, Antamonique Carpenter, Jerry Pearson, MPD Detective Thomas Dineen, MPD Detective Lynda Stott, Wilbert McDonald, Ruben Lopez, MPD Detective Dawn Jones Exhibits 20-21, 25, 26-29 40-42, 30-39, 50 received.

Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  MPD Detective Lynda Stott, Detective Dan Murphy Hillside, IL., Sgt. Ray Roidakovich Greenfield PD, MPD Officer Ismar Kulenovie, MPD Officer Henry Dummann, Terika Dilworth, Exhibits 1-16, 23-24, 18 received.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Montreavous Lamar Gray not in court, in custody not produced.  Cindy L. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.     Defense counsel has received discovery.  State's motion to be filed with the court by March 18, 2015, defense's response by March 31, 2015.   State moves to have this case run long with defendant's other case 14CF4596.  Court does not object.  Case is adjourned for Motion/Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 10.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
